Levels.9: Presentation of the payoff for both options.
Levels.10: Presentation of the probability for both options.
Levels.20: Beginning of the waiting time for the result.

good.Description: Trials correctly presented on the screen {0, 1}.

a.Description: Ambiguity area as a proportion of the bar [0, 0.8].

bias.Description: Bias in the actual division of the option behind the mask: 0 indicates the left extreme, 0.5 represents the middle of the mask, and 1 indicates the right extreme.

p.Description: Actual probability [0, 1] of the left option, with the right option taking the value of (1 - p).

pv.Description: Visible probability [0, 1] of the left option, that is, without taking into account the hidden area (a). [pv * (1 - a) + (1 - pv) * (1 - a) + a = 1] and [pv * (1 - a) + (bias) * a = p]. The right option takes the value of (1 - pv).

TMSips.Description: For EEG/TMS sessions, a dummy variable {0, 1} indicating TMS over the intraparietal sulcus.

TMSppc.Description: For EEG/TMS sessions, a dummy variable {0, 1} indicating TMS over the posterior parietal cortex."

TMSvertex.Description: For eeg/TMS sessions, a dummy variable {0, 1} indicating TMS over the vertex.

delta.Description: For EEG sessions, indicate the discrepancy between the time on the computer during stimuli presentation and the time recorded by the EEG recording computer

fixed.Description: For the EEG sessions, a dummy variable {0, 1} indicating that the stimuli code was lost in the EEG recording (.vmrk) but was recovered from the computer of the stimuli presentation.
